item.title: Hackney Council Van Dangerous Driver, 19th January
item.description:
Someone driving a council van just ran a red light, almost mowing over several of us, then mounted the curb on casenove road before careening off. The driver is clearly unfit to drive, we couldn’t get the license plate.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stamford Hill, West Hackney, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unauthorised motor vehicles - Hoblingwell Wood, 19th January
item.description:
Motor vehicles are being driven into Hoblingwell Wood at the end of the barrier adjacent to Leesons Way, opposite number 93. I am told that this happened yesterday (Sunday) and involved three large petrol scramblers that were doing circuits along Leesons Way, through the woodland and around the eastern meadow and sports playing fields. Please could this be monitored and investigated with a view to finding a lasting solution?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leesons Way, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Requirement for double yellow lines - road safety, 19th January
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing outside El Molino on Beckenham Road is unsafe when crossing from that side due to the constant parking of vehicles to the right of the crossing (by Mackenzie Road). Parked vehicles obstruct view of oncoming traffic, and pedestrians are at high risk of being hit. This is compounded by the fact the crossing is located at the crest of a hill so cars are accelerating up towards the crossing. Replacing the single yellow lines with double yellows would resolved this problem.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 251, Beckenham Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
